content.description:
Hellcat climbs really well despite being so close to the ground.

Sit start with a good left hand sidepull and a right hand edge. From the, make a big right hand move to an incut sidepull, slap the left hand along the arete's bump to a block, gain a right hand pinch, and then a jug, bump the left hand further up the arete, follow to the jugs up top, and mantel on.
content.protection: A pair of pads. It's low, clear, and flat though.
content.location: It climbs the overhang on Hellcat's west face.

content.description: Sit start with a good left hand sidepull and a right hand palming the face. From there, reach a great right hand sidepull, bump up, slap the left hand up to a giant undercling, achieve awkward footing, reach the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Hellcat.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand edge on the arete and a left hand two finger pocket on the face. From there, slap up the arete, and work the edges and pockets on the face to reach an easy mantel. Feet are tough on this one.
content.protection: A pad. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the west side of Hellcat's southwest arete.
